body:
A proposed solution is to pass token taken from relational query context to call of IExecutionStrategy.ExecuteAsync(...) 

https://github.com/dotnet/efcore/pull/31449

issue.title: Fix to #31448 Use token for NonQueryResultAsync

repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.

rename.from: Cancelled token does not prevent execution of ExecuteDeleteAsync(token)
rename.to: [BUG-FIX] Cancelled token does not prevent execution of ExecuteDeleteAsync(token)

rename.from: [BUG-FIX] Cancelled token does not prevent execution of ExecuteDeleteAsync(token)
rename.to: Cancelled token does not prevent execution of ExecuteDeleteAsync(token)

issue.title: Is RelationalQueryableExtensions.ExecuteUpdateAsync meant to ignore cancellation?

repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.

body:
@ajcvickers, which is the fix version for this issue?
It's not going to be in some minor patch 7.0.*, right?
@dsgordeev we haven't discussed this yet - note that the milestone on this issue is empty. We'll update this issue when a decision is made.
